At 10:25 AM 10/11/00 -0600, you wrote:
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 10:02 AM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
>
>
>One thing I find ridiculous - I believe that a lot of our "nerfs" came about
>because of other players complaining about bards being too powerful. The
>mana component of the higher-level charm song for example - came when (IIRC)
>a Druid started ranting about bards taking all the Giants in Rathe Mountain.
>
>I've noticed now more and more Druids doing the "Quad Kiting" tactic - of
>kiting 4 mobs at once. Whets unbalanced for a bard is perfectly acceptable
>for a Druid...

yeah they get to kill 4 mobs at once. then they med for 15-20 minutes. bards never
had to do this when charm didn't have a mana cost. there was absolutely no downtime
for bards who knew what they were doing when charming. let's try to compare apples
to apples here.


>Ranting once again
